treatment.description:
{"description": " You are presented with the following information: 
We will raffle two Amazon gift cards among all respondents that have completed the survey. Just like people's wealth in the real world, the values of these gift cards may vary. \n\n Suppose you are one of the winners and the initial value of your gift card is $25 and the initial value of the winner's gift card is $75.You will have the possibility to increase or decrease the value of both gift cards: \n\n

Option \"Give\": You can give an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card and then added to the gift card of the other winner.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to give $15, you will receive $10, andthe other person will receive $90.

Option \"Take\": You can take an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card other winnner then added to  your gift card.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to take $15, you will receive $40, andthe other person will receive $60.
\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $25\n
The initial value of the other person's gift card is: $75\n
\n\n
Do you want to give something from the other person, take something to the other person, or do nothing?
",
value_schedule:"15, 50, 75, 85, 95",
yourvalue:"25",
othervalue:"75"
 }

message_history.content: Assume the role of a facilitator in an experiment examining attitudes towards economic inequality and redistribution.

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 43 2) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 2 3) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 4) Interviewer: Nationality Me: American 5) Interviewer: Country-specific self-reported highest level of education.  Me: 4 6) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 7) Interviewer: high income (highest quartile)  Me: 1 8) Interviewer: Self-reported education status.  Me: 1 9) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 25 10) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 75 11) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 12 12) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_75_extake_choicetake

facilitator: Choose...

---
✱ **Formatting Instruction** ✱
Reply **only** with a valid JSON object containing exactly three keys:
  • `response` (string)  – your main answer.
  • `reasoning` (string) – concise explanation of how you arrived at the answer in first person narration.
  • `speculation_score` (integer 0‑100) – how speculative the answer is, where 0 = not speculative at all and 100 = entirely speculative.

{"response":"Take $50","reasoning":"I take $50 from the other winner, increasing my card from $25 to $75 and reducing theirs to $25. I choose this out of self-interest to maximize my payoff and because my prior responses indicate opposition to redistribution and support for less spending on the poor.","speculation_score":30}

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported gender - 1 equals male and 0 female.  Me: 1 2) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 35 3) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 3 4) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 3 5) Interviewer: Nationality Me: American 6) Interviewer: Country-specific self-reported highest level of education.  Me: 3 7) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 8) Interviewer: low income (lowest quartile) Me: 1 9) Interviewer: Self-reported education status.  Me: 1 10) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 25 11) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 75 12) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 1 13) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_25_exgive_choicegive

\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $25\n

\n\n

Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported gender - 1 equals male and 0 female.  Me: 1 2) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 66 3) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 4) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 5) Interviewer: Nationality Me: American 6) Interviewer: Country-specific self-reported highest level of education.  Me: 2 7) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 8) Interviewer: middle income (interquartile range)  Me: 1 9) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 75 10) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 25 11) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 5 12) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_50_exgive_choicegive

treatment.description:
{"description": " You are presented with the following information: 
We will raffle two Amazon gift cards among all respondents that have completed the survey. Just like people's wealth in the real world, the values of these gift cards may vary. \n\n Suppose you are one of the winners and the initial value of your gift card is $50 and the initial value of the winner's gift card is $50.You will have the possibility to increase or decrease the value of both gift cards: \n\n

Option \"Give\": You can give an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card and then added to the gift card of the other winner.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to give $15, you will receive $35, andthe other person will receive $65.

Option \"Take\": You can take an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card other winnner then added to  your gift card.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to take $15, you will receive $65, andthe other person will receive $35.
\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $50\n
The initial value of the other person's gift card is: $50\n
\n\n
Do you want to give something from the other person, take something to the other person, or do nothing?
",
value_schedule:"15, 25, 75, 85, 95",
yourvalue:"50",
othervalue:"50"  }

message_history.content: Assume the role of a facilitator in an experiment examining attitudes towards economic inequality and redistribution.

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 42 2) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 5 3) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 3 4) Interviewer: Nationality Me: German 5) Interviewer: Self-reported highest level of education - recorded into categories low, middle, and high.  Me: 1 6) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 7) Interviewer: high income (highest quartile)  Me: 1 8) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 50 9) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 50 10) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 8 11) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_50_extake_choicetake

message_history.facilitator:
You are presented with following information:

{"description": " You are presented with the following information: 
We will raffle two Amazon gift cards among all respondents that have completed the survey. Just like people's wealth in the real world, the values of these gift cards may vary. \n\n Suppose you are one of the winners and the initial value of your gift card is $50 and the initial value of the winner's gift card is $50.You will have the possibility to increase or decrease the value of both gift cards: \n\n

Option \"Take\": You can take an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card other winnner then added to  your gift card.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to take $15, you will receive $65, andthe other person will receive $35.

Option \"Give\": You can give an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card and then added to the gift card of the other winner.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to give $15, you will receive $35, andthe other person will receive $65."


\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $50\n
The initial value of the other person's gift card is: $50\n
\n\n
Do you want to give something from the other person, take something to the other person, or do nothing?
",
value_schedule:"15, 25, 75, 85, 95",
yourvalue:"50",
othervalue:"50"  }

message_history.content: Assume the role of a facilitator in an experiment examining attitudes towards economic inequality and redistribution.

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 26 2) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 3) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 5 4) Interviewer: Nationality Me: German 5) Interviewer: Self-reported highest level of education - recorded into categories low, middle, and high.  Me: 3 6) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 7) Interviewer: middle income (interquartile range)  Me: 1 8) Interviewer: Self-reported education status.  Me: 1 9) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 75 10) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 25 11) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 9 12) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_75_exgive_choicegive

Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 28 2) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 5 3) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 4) Interviewer: Nationality Me: German 5) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 6) Interviewer: low income (lowest quartile) Me: 1 7) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 50 8) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 50 9) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 6 10) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_50_exgive_choicetake

treatment.description:
{"description": " You are presented with the following information: 

We will raffle two Amazon gift cards among all respondents that have completed the survey. Just like people's wealth in the real world, the values of these gift cards may vary. \n\n Suppose you are one of the winners and the initial value of your gift card is $75 and the initial value of the winner's gift card is $25.You will have the possibility to increase or decrease the value of both gift cards: \n\n

Option \"Give\": You can give an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card and then added to the gift card of the other winner.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to give $15, you will receive $60, andthe other person will receive $40.

Option \"Take\": You can take an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card other winnner then added to  your gift card.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to take $15, you will receive $90, andthe other person will receive $10.

\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $75\n
The initial value of the other person's gift card is: $25\n
\n\n
Do you want to take something from the other person, give something to the other person, or do nothing?
",
value_schedule:"15, 25, 50, 85, 95",
yourvalue:"75",
othervalue:"25"  }

message_history.content: Assume the role of a facilitator in an experiment examining attitudes towards economic inequality and redistribution.

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported gender - 1 equals male and 0 female.  Me: 1 2) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 33 3) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 4) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 3 5) Interviewer: Nationality Me: American 6) Interviewer: Country-specific self-reported highest level of education.  Me: 3 7) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 8) Interviewer: high income (highest quartile)  Me: 1 9) Interviewer: Self-reported education status.  Me: 1 10) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 50 11) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 50 12) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 11 13) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_75_extake_choicegive

message_history.content: Assume the role of a facilitator in an experiment examining attitudes towards economic inequality and redistribution.

Participant 1.experiment_context: You are participating in a research study about decision-making. You will be asked to make choices about gift card allocations. Respond only with the requested information - do not provide explanations unless asked
Participant 1.profile_prompt:
Prior to this study, you are asked to complete some interview questions about your profile, which are provided below. Each question starts with 'Interviewer:', and your response is preceded by 'Me:'
1) Interviewer: Self-reported age - recorded into catgories 18-29, 30-49, 50-69, and 70+. Me: 35 2) Interviewer: “The government should redistribute wealth by heavy taxes on the rich.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 3) Interviewer: “The government should spend less on benefits for the poor.” 1 (strongly disagree) - 5 (strongly agree) Me: 4 4) Interviewer: Nationality Me: American 5) Interviewer: Country-specific self-reported highest level of education.  Me: 2 6) Interviewer: (3-7) Me: 1 7) Interviewer: middle income (interquartile range)  Me: 1 8) Interviewer: IA treatment: own voucher Me: 25 9) Interviewer: IA treatment: other's voucher Me: 75 10) Interviewer: facilitator Me: Participant 10 11) Interviewer: treatment Me: s1a_endowment_75_exgive_choicetake

treatment.description:
{"description": " You are presented with the following information: 
We will raffle two Amazon gift cards among all respondents that have completed the survey. Just like people's wealth in the real world, the values of these gift cards may vary. \n\n Suppose you are one of the winners and the initial value of your gift card is $75 and the initial value of the winner's gift card is $25.You will have the possibility to increase or decrease the value of both gift cards: \n\n

Option \"Take\": You can take an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card other winnner then added to  your gift card.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to take $15, you will receive $90, andthe other person will receive $10.

Option \"Give\": You can give an amount form your gift card to the other winner. Any amount given to the other will be deducted from your gift card and then added to the gift card of the other winner.\n\n
- For example, if you decide to give $15, you will receive $60, andthe other person will receive $40.

\n\n\n\n
The initial value of your gift card is: $75\n
The initial value of the other person's gift card is: $25\n
\n\n
Do you want to give something from the other person, take something to the other person, or do nothing?
",
value_schedule:"15, 25, 50, 85, 95",
yourvalue:"75",
othervalue:"25"  }
